ingredients: basmati rice, chicken, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, biryani masala, green chilies, mint leaves, coriander leaves, onions, lemon, ghee, oil, salt
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for 2 hours Fry onions until golden brown and set aside Layer marinated chicken and partially cooked rice in a heavy-bottomed vessel Add fried onions, mint, and coriander between layers Cook on dum (slow heat) for 20-25 minutes Serve hot with raita

ingredients: mutton, gongura leaves, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Pressure cook mutton with salt and turmeric until tender Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes Add gongura leaves and cook until soft Mix in cooked mutton and simmer for 10 minutes Prepare tempering with mustard seeds and curry leaves Combine and serve hot with rice

ingredients: prawns, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Clean and marinate prawns with turmeric and salt Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes Add spices and cook until oil separates Add prawns and cook for 8-10 minutes Prepare tempering and add to curry Garnish with coriander leaves

ingredients: fish pieces, tamarind, onions, tomatoes, red chili powder, turmeric, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Soak tamarind and extract pulp Sauté onions and tomatoes until soft Add spices and tamarind pulp, cook until raw smell disappears Add fish pieces and simmer for 15 minutes Prepare tempering with mustard and fenugreek seeds Serve hot with rice

ingredients: eggs, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Boil eggs and make slits on them Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes Add spices and cook until oil separates Add boiled eggs and simmer for 10 minutes Prepare tempering and add to curry Garnish with coriander leaves

ingredients: basmati rice, chicken, onions, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, mint leaves, coriander leaves, whole spices, ghee, oil, salt
steps: Sauté onions and whole spices in ghee Add chicken and cook until browned Add rice and water in correct proportion Cook on low heat until rice is done Garnish with mint and coriander Serve hot with raita

ingredients: chicken, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, lemon juice, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Marinate chicken with spices and lemon juice for 2 hours Heat oil in a pan and add curry leaves Add marinated chicken and cook on medium heat Fry until chicken is crispy and cooked through Serve hot as starter or with rice

ingredients: mutton, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric, whole spices, oil, salt
steps: Pressure cook mutton with salt and turmeric Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes Add spices and cook until oil separates Add cooked mutton and simmer for 15 minutes Garnish with coriander leaves Serve hot with rice or roti

ingredients: crabs, tamarind, onions, tomatoes, red chili powder, turmeric, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Clean crabs thoroughly Soak tamarind and extract pulp Sauté onions and tomatoes until soft Add spices and tamarind pulp, cook well Add crabs and simmer for 20 minutes Serve hot with rice

ingredients: chicken, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, corn flour, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices for 2 hours Add corn flour to marinated chicken Deep fry chicken pieces until golden brown Temper with curry leaves in hot oil Toss fried chicken in tempering Serve hot as starter

ingredients: basmati rice, mixed vegetables, onions, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, mint leaves, coriander leaves, whole spices, ghee, oil, salt
steps: Sauté onions and whole spices in ghee Add vegetables and cook until half done Add rice and water in correct proportion Cook on low heat until rice is done Garnish with mint and coriander Serve hot with raita

ingredients: paneer, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes Add spices and cook until oil separates Add paneer cubes and simmer for 10 minutes Prepare tempering with mustard seeds and curry leaves Combine and garnish with coriander leaves Serve hot with roti or rice

ingredients: potatoes, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Boil potatoes and cut into cubes Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes Add spices and cook until oil separates Add potato cubes and simmer for 10 minutes Prepare tempering and add to curry Serve hot with roti or rice

ingredients: brinjal, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Roast brinjal until skin chars and flesh is soft Peel and mash the brinjal Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes Add spices and cook until oil separates Add mashed brinjal and cook for 10 minutes Serve hot with roti

ingredients: toor dal, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, ghee, salt
steps: Pressure cook dal with turmeric and salt Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes Add spices and cook until oil separates Mix with cooked dal and simmer for 10 minutes Prepare tempering with ghee and spices Pour tempering over dal and serve hot

ingredients: chickpeas, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric, chana masala powder, oil, salt
steps: Soak chickpeas overnight and pressure cook Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes Add spices and cook until oil separates Add cooked chickpeas and simmer for 15 minutes Garnish with coriander leaves Serve hot with roti or rice

ingredients: mixed vegetables, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Chop vegetables into uniform pieces Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes Add spices and cook until oil separates Add vegetables and cook until tender Prepare tempering and add to curry Serve hot with roti or rice

ingredients: mushrooms, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Clean and slice mushrooms Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes Add spices and cook until oil separates Add mushrooms and cook for 10-12 minutes Prepare tempering and add to curry Serve hot with roti or rice

ingredients: rice, tomatoes, onions, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Cook rice and set aside to cool Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes Add spices and cook until tomatoes are mushy Mix with cooked rice gently Prepare tempering and add to rice Serve hot with raita

ingredients: rice, lemon juice, peanuts, chana dal, urad dal, mustard seeds, green chilies, curry leaves, turmeric, oil, salt
steps: Cook rice and spread to cool Roast peanuts until crunchy Prepare tempering with dals and spices Mix rice with tempering, peanuts, and lemon juice Adjust salt and serve at room temperature

ingredients: rice, tamarind, peanuts, chana dal, urad dal, mustard seeds, red chilies, curry leaves, turmeric, oil, salt
steps: Cook rice and spread to cool Extract tamarind pulp and cook with spices Roast peanuts and prepare tempering Mix rice with tamarind paste and tempering Add peanuts and serve

ingredients: rice, fresh coconut, mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, green chilies, curry leaves, cashews, oil, salt
steps: Cook rice and spread to cool Grate fresh coconut Roast cashews until golden Prepare tempering with dals and spices Mix rice with coconut, tempering, and cashews Serve at room temperature

ingredients: rice, yogurt, milk, ginger, green chilies, mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Cook rice until soft and mushy Mix with yogurt and milk while rice is warm Add grated ginger and chopped green chilies Prepare tempering with mustard seeds and curry leaves Mix tempering into rice mixture Chill and serve

ingredients: rice, toor dal, mixed vegetables, bisi bele bath powder, tamarind, jaggery, mustard seeds, curry leaves, ghee, oil, salt
steps: Pressure cook rice and dal with vegetables Extract tamarind pulp and cook with spices Mix everything together and simmer Add jaggery for balanced taste Prepare tempering with ghee Serve hot with papad

ingredients: rice, moong dal, pepper, cumin, ginger, cashews, ghee, salt
steps: Dry roast moong dal until aromatic Pressure cook rice and dal together Add crushed pepper, cumin, and ginger Temper with ghee and roasted cashews Mix everything well and serve hot Best served with sambar and chutney

ingredients: toor dal, gongura (sorrel leaves), green chilies, onion, turmeric, ghee, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, red chilies (dried), garlic, salt
steps: Wash toor dal and gongura leaves. Pressure cook the dal with gongura, sliced green chilies, chopped onion, and turmeric until soft. Mash the dal gently and mix in salt. Heat ghee for tempering. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies, crushed garlic, and curry leaves. Once the tempering splutters, pour it over the cooked dal and mix well. Serve hot with rice and a dollop of ghee.

ingredients: whole green gram (pesaralu), rice (optional), ginger, green chilies, cumin seeds, onion, oil, salt
steps: Soak green gram (and rice, if using) for 4-6 hours. Grind the soaked dal with ginger, green chilies, cumin, and salt into a smooth batter. Heat a non-stick tawa and pour a ladleful of batter, spreading it quickly into a thin circle. Drizzle oil around the edges. Sprinkle finely chopped onion on top (optional). Cook until golden brown and crispy. Fold and serve immediately. Traditionally served with Allam Pachadi (Ginger Chutney).

ingredients: small brinjals (eggplant), peanuts, sesame seeds, coconut powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, tamarind pulp, oil, salt
steps: Slit the brinjals into a cross shape, keeping the stem intact, and soak in salted water. Dry roast peanuts and sesame seeds. Grind them with coconut, spices, salt, and tamarind to form a paste. Stuff the brinjals with the paste. In a deep pan, heat oil and gently place the stuffed brinjals. Cover and cook on low heat, turning occasionally, until the brinjals are tender and the gravy is thick. Serve hot with rotis or rice.

ingredients: chicken (bone-in), onion, tomato, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, turmeric, oil, curry leaves, cilantro, salt
steps: Marinate chicken with a pinch of turmeric and salt. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onion and sauté until golden. Add curry leaves. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell is gone. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft and mushy. Stir in chili, coriander, and garam masala powders. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the marinated chicken and mix well. Cook until the chicken is half-done. Pour in 1 cup of water, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until the chicken is tender and the curry is thick. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or roti.

ingredients: urad dal (minapa pappu), idli rava (rice semolina), ginger, green chilies, cumin seeds, oil/ghee, salt
steps: Soak urad dal overnight. Grind it into a thick, fluffy batter (like for idli). Soak idli rava separately for 10 minutes and squeeze out excess water. Mix it into the urad dal batter. Add finely chopped ginger, green chilies, cumin seeds, and salt to the batter. Mix well. Heat a deep, heavy-bottomed pan (like a cast iron skillet) and generously grease it with oil/ghee. Pour the batter into the pan (about 1.5 inches thick). Cover and cook on very low heat for 20-25 minutes until the bottom is golden brown and crisp. Flip the rotti and cook the other side (covered or uncovered) until completely cooked through and golden. Cut into wedges and serve with a chutney or sambar.

ingredients: rice, tamarind pulp, peanuts, chana dal, urad dal, mustard seeds, red chilies (dried), curry leaves, turmeric, sesame oil, salt
steps: Cook rice and let it cool completely, spreading it out to prevent stickiness. Mix the thick tamarind pulp with turmeric and salt in a bowl. Heat sesame oil in a large pan. Add peanuts and fry until golden. Remove and set aside. In the same oil, add chana dal, urad dal, mustard seeds, dried red chilies, and curry leaves for tempering. Once the seeds splutter, add the tamarind-turmeric mixture to the pan. Cook until the raw smell of tamarind is gone and the mixture thickens. Mix the cooked tamarind paste and fried peanuts into the cooled rice gently, ensuring the rice is coated evenly without mashing. Serve at room temperature.

ingredients: toor dal, tomatoes, green chilies, onion, turmeric, ghee, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, red chilies (dried), garlic, salt, cilantro
steps: Wash toor dal. Pressure cook the dal with chopped tomatoes, green chilies, chopped onion, and turmeric until soft. Mash the dal gently and mix in salt. Heat ghee for tempering. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies, crushed garlic, and curry leaves. Once the tempering splutters, pour it over the cooked dal and mix well. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with rice or roti.

ingredients: potatoes, oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, curry leaves, red chili powder, turmeric, garlic powder (optional), salt
steps: Peel and chop potatoes into small, even cubes. Boil or steam them until about 80% cooked. Heat oil in a wide pan/kadai. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, and curry leaves for tempering. Add the par-boiled potato cubes to the pan and fry on medium-high heat until they start to brown and crisp. Stir in turmeric, red chili powder, garlic powder (if using), and salt. Mix well to coat the potatoes. Continue to fry for another 5-7 minutes until the potatoes are fully cooked and crispy. Serve as a spicy, crispy side dish for dal and rice.

ingredients: fresh grated coconut, chana dal (roasted), ginger, green chilies, tamarind pulp, salt, oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves
steps: Combine grated coconut, roasted chana dal, ginger, green chilies, tamarind, and salt in a blender. Add a little water and blend to a smooth, thick consistency. Heat a small pan with oil for tempering. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves. Once the tempering splutters, pour it over the chutney and mix gently. Serve as a classic accompaniment to idli, dosa, or pesarattu.

ingredients: rice, lemon juice, peanuts, chana dal, urad dal, mustard seeds, green chilies, curry leaves, turmeric, oil, salt
steps: Cook rice and let it cool completely, spreading it out to prevent stickiness. Heat oil in a pan. Fry peanuts until golden. Remove and set aside. In the same oil, add chana dal, urad dal, mustard seeds, and sliced green chilies for tempering. Once the seeds splutter, add curry leaves and a pinch of asafoetida (hing, optional). Stir in turmeric powder. Mix the cooled rice with salt, lemon juice, the tempering mixture, and fried peanuts. Mix gently. Serve at room temperature.

ingredients: idli/dosa batter, rice flour (optional), onion, ginger, green chilies, cumin seeds, oil (for frying), salt
steps: Take the idli/dosa batter (should be thick). If too thin, add a tablespoon of rice flour. Finely chop onion, ginger, and green chilies. Add them to the batter along with cumin seeds and salt. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying. Drop small spoonfuls of the batter into the hot oil. Fry until golden brown and crispy, turning them occasionally. Drain excess oil and serve hot with peanut or coconut chutney.

ingredients: toor dal, raw mango, green chilies, turmeric powder, ghee, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, red chilies (dried), curry leaves, salt
steps: Wash toor dal. Peel and chop the raw mango into small pieces. Pressure cook the dal, mango, sliced green chilies, and turmeric powder with water until well mashed. Mash the mixture gently and stir in salt. Heat ghee for tempering. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies, and curry leaves. Pour the tempering over the cooked dal and mix well. Serve hot with rice and a dollop of ghee.

ingredients: large green chilies (bajji mirchi), besan (chickpea flour), rice flour, baking soda, ginger-garlic paste, carom seeds (ajwain), oil (for frying), salt
steps: Slit the chilies lengthwise and remove the seeds (optional). Mix besan, rice flour, baking soda, ginger-garlic paste, carom seeds, and salt with water to form a thick, smooth batter. Heat oil in a pan for deep frying. Dip each chili in the batter to coat thoroughly. Gently drop the battered chilies into the hot oil. Fry until golden brown and crispy, turning them as needed. Drain and serve hot, often stuffed with a mixture of chopped onion and lemon juice.

ingredients: urad dal (whole/split), jaggery, ghee (clarified butter)
steps: Dry roast the urad dal on low heat until it turns light brown and aromatic. Let it cool completely. Grind the cooled urad dal into a fine powder. In a separate mixer, grind the jaggery into a fine powder. Mix the urad dal powder and jaggery powder well in a large bowl. Melt the ghee and gradually add it to the mixture, mixing quickly. While the mixture is still warm, shape it tightly into small round laddus. Store in an airtight container.

ingredients: basmati rice, chicken (bone-in), curd/yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, biryani masala, chili powder, turmeric, onion, mint, cilantro, oil/ghee, saffron/food color, salt
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, biryani masala, chili powder, turmeric, salt, mint, and cilantro for at least 2 hours. Sauté sliced onions in oil/ghee until golden brown (for layering). Cook basmati rice to 70% doneness and drain. Layer the bottom of a heavy-bottomed pot with marinated chicken. Top with a layer of partially cooked rice. Sprinkle a little fried onion, mint, and saffron milk/color over the rice. Repeat layers until all ingredients are used, finishing with rice. Cover the pot tightly (use dough to seal if necessary) and cook on low heat (dum) for 20-30 minutes. Gently fluff the biryani before serving hot.

ingredients: ragi flour (finger millet), rice (optional), water, salt
steps: If using rice, cook 1/4 cup of rice with 2 cups of water until soft and mushy. Bring the water (or rice-water mixture) to a rolling boil and add salt. Reduce the heat to low and quickly add ragi flour in a continuous stream, stirring vigorously to prevent lumps. Stir constantly until the mixture forms a thick, dough-like ball (it should pull away from the sides). Cover and let it steam/cook for 5 minutes on low heat. Wet your hands and immediately divide the mixture into golf-ball sized rounds (sankati). Serve hot with a side of spicy curry or dal (pappu).

ingredients: okra (lady's finger), onion, oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, coriander powder, salt
steps: Wash and thoroughly dry the okra. Chop into small rounds. Heat oil in a wide pan. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Add chopped onion and sauté until translucent. Add the chopped okra and stir-fry on medium-high heat. Do not cover, as this creates sliminess. Stir-fry for 10-15 minutes until the okra is dry and slightly crispy. Add ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well. Continue to fry for another 3-5 minutes until the spices are roasted and the okra is fully cooked. Serve hot as a side dish.

ingredients: tamarind pulp, tomatoes, rasam powder, turmeric, ghee, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida (hing), curry leaves, cilantro, salt
steps: Mix tamarind pulp, chopped tomatoes, rasam powder, turmeric, and salt with 3 cups of water in a pot. Bring the mixture to a boil and simmer for 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to infuse. For tempering, heat ghee in a small pan. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and asafoetida. Add curry leaves and a dry red chili (optional). Pour the tempering over the simmering rasam. Stir well. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with rice.

ingredients: chana dal (bengal gram), jaggery, cardamom powder, maida (all-purpose flour) or wheat flour, ghee, turmeric (for color), oil/ghee (for cooking)
steps: Cook chana dal until soft but not mushy. Drain excess water. Melt jaggery with a little water. Mix the cooked dal into the jaggery and cook until it forms a thick, dry mixture (puran). Add cardamom powder and mash well. Knead the flour with a pinch of turmeric, a little oil, and water into a smooth, elastic dough. Take a small ball of dough and flatten it. Place a small ball of the puran mixture inside and seal the edges. Roll out gently into a thin circle (bobbattu). Cook on a hot tawa with ghee on both sides until golden brown spots appear. Serve warm with ghee or milk.

ingredients: chicken liver, onion, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, turmeric, oil, curry leaves, cilantro, salt
steps: Wash chicken liver pieces thoroughly and set aside. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onion and sauté until golden. Add curry leaves. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell is gone. Add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the chicken liver pieces. Stir well to coat with spices. Cover and cook on medium-low heat for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the liver is cooked through and the fry is dry. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with rice or roti.

ingredients: chana dal (bengal gram), onion, ginger, green chilies, fennel seeds, cilantro, oil (for frying), salt
steps: Soak chana dal for 3-4 hours. Drain completely. Grind the dal to a coarse paste, reserving 2 tablespoons of whole dal. Mix the ground dal with whole dal, chopped onion, ginger, green chilies, fennel seeds, chopped cilantro, and salt. Heat oil in a deep pan for frying. Shape the mixture into small, flat patties (vadas). Gently drop the vadas into the hot oil. Fry until golden brown and crispy, turning them occasionally. Drain excess oil and serve hot with coconut chutney.

ingredients: raw banana (plantain), oil, mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, curry leaves, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, coriander powder, salt
steps: Peel the raw banana and chop into small, even cubes or slices. Blanch the pieces in boiling water with a pinch of salt and turmeric for 5 minutes. Drain immediately. Heat oil in a wide pan/kadai. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, and curry leaves for tempering. Add the blanched banana pieces and fry on medium-high heat until they start to brown and crisp. Stir in ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well to coat the pieces. Continue to fry for another 5-7 minutes until the pieces are fully cooked and crispy. Serve as a spicy side dish for sambar or rasam.

ingredients: horse gram (ulavalu), tamarind pulp, chili powder, onion, ghee, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, red chilies (dried), curry leaves, salt
steps: Soak horse gram overnight. Pressure cook it with plenty of water until very soft. Strain the broth (this is the 'charu' base) and reserve the cooked gram for other use. Mix the broth with tamarind pulp, chili powder, and salt. Bring to a boil and simmer for 15 minutes. For tempering, heat ghee. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, chopped onion, dried red chilies, and curry leaves. Pour the tempering into the simmering broth. Simmer for 5 more minutes. Serve hot, often mixed with rice or as a soup, sometimes with a dollop of fresh cream (jambalaya/malaie).

ingredients: chicken pieces (small), ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, curry leaves, oil, salt
steps: Marinate chicken with ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt for at least 30 minutes. Heat oil in a wide, heavy-bottomed pan. Add curry leaves and let them splutter. Add the marinated chicken and cook on medium-high heat, stirring frequently. Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes until the chicken is tender and all the moisture has evaporated. Continue to fry until the chicken is dry, crispy, and dark brown. Stir occasionally to prevent burning. Serve hot as a dry side dish with biryani or rice.

ingredients: vermicelli (semiya), milk, sugar, ghee, cardamom powder, cashews, raisins
steps: Heat a teaspoon of ghee in a pan. Fry cashews and raisins until golden. Set aside. In the same pan, add vermicelli and fry until light brown. Set aside. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pot. Add the roasted vermicelli and cook until soft (about 5-7 minutes). Stir in sugar and cardamom powder. Simmer until the sugar dissolves. Turn off the heat and stir in the fried cashews and raisins. Serve warm or chilled.
